text: Replying directly Jonathan ... thanks
<@U0KPFAZNF> Hi Greg, any other COP issues in the e2e testing?  I'll be glad to work with you today if there are any.
We will report whatever we find… yes, we will need to work closely with you <@U0S5KF44D>, and btw, thank you <@U13TWBRBL> too for your help last night.
As for your direct reply Keith: thank you. Yes, all I want to know is that we plan on testing this stuff, rather than just assuming that “if it’s merged, it works ;-)”.

The simplest way is to really get more people trying this stuff out, get them/us all to  report issues, and getting them fixed. It’s time consuming, but there is no other way. Just need to take this into account.
No problem ... certainly not making the "it works" assumption ... we are testing the best we know how, but as always, we will miss things and will fix asap when problems reported
<@U0P2GSA8Z|arnaud> has joined the channel
hi there
I've been trying to compile cop in vagrant but this is a painful experience
is that only known to compile on MacOS?
it needs a bunch of libraries that are not part of our vagrant image
first I had to fool around with busybox to compile
then I had to install rocksdb
now it's missing libbz2 and libsnappy
it's like it never ends
I love how the README just says to do "make cop" :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U0P2GSA8Z>: [amiably:] please don’t get me started :wink:
I have been building natively on MacOS, but even for that, to be honest, had to tweak a few things in the system...
Are you on a Thinkpad?
(windows/VBox) ?
yep
I tried to use the vagrant image we have for fabric but it really doesn't cut it
of course the fact that this image doesn't even work for fabric isn't a good start :wink:
<@U0P2GSA8Z> I suspect you are running into one of the issues we (Jonathan and I) ran into yesterday
as a workaround, "make docker" from here <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3843/> seems to work
then you can run it with "docker run -it --rm -p8888:8888 hyperledger/fabric-cop
I thought you guys had problem running it
I can't even get it to build!
i was going to take a look at the native build today
I am not sure whats wrong yet, but the fact that its asking for rocksdb is suspect
ok
(rocksdb was removed from vagrant/docker a while back)
that's what I thought
Let alone from the code/dependencies...
I was surprised too
so the fact that it compiles under docker without implies it truely isnt needed, but something is going awry in the native build
fwiw, late last night I was able to stand up fabric-cop in the manner mentioned above and get the latest node-sdk to complete an enrollment
good for you!
for what it's worth, the problem I have with all the missing libs shows up as follows:

fabric-cop/cli$ go build -o ../bin/cop
# <http://github.com/hyperledger/fabric-cop/vendor/github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3|github.com/hyperledger/fabric-cop/vendor/github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3>
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lbz2
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lsnappy
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
it's the same command that reported rocksdb missing before
<@U0P2GSA8Z> I have a theory
but i havent had a chance to try it yet
can you show me these two commands:
pwd
env | grep GOPATH
(from fabric-cop/cli

$ pwd
/opt/gopath/src/github.com/hyperledger/fabric-cop/cli
that's because I tried to launch the go command myself
(understood, I was trying the same thing yesterday)
the make cop goes the same
yep, agreed

$ echo $GOPATH
/opt/gopath
ok, well, there goes that theory
heh
LOL
in my case, my fabric-cop.git was not in the GOPATH so I was speculating that was part of my problem
I see
<@U0P2GSA8Z> how about the OS you are on?
someone mentioned some known issue with ubuntu 16.04
I was in vagrant yesterday, and thus in 16.04 IIRC
yes, I'm in vagrant
yes
ok, so perhaps this is the clue
by the way, I couldn't run behave in vagrant either for fabric
it's missing a couple of python modules I had to install
I heard about this: behave is in a state of neglect atm
sha3 and openssl
one of the tasks on my plate is to migrate behave execution to the $(DRUN) facility and then we can add the proper python stuff to testenv
to be clear, thats not an excuse to have to be broken though
I think the reason its broken partly is that we (to my knowledge) no longer rely on the behave results in CI
thus, attention is waning
well, the missing modules is a problem with vagrant, not behave
and I am not surprised some entropy has entered
although of course it exhibits itself when we try to run behave
I understand
understood
what I am saying is: in my plan for the DRUN integration, the dependency mechanism would ride inside fabric.git as part of the testenv docker creation
rather than outside, in the baseimage/vagrant definition
which would provide slightly better coupling
ok
it also seems that behave ends up hanging somewhere down the line while running the tests
that wouldnt surprise me, given that its not run in CI
<@U0P2GSA8Z>: <@U0KPFAZNF> all the issues i came across, for bddtest there's already a patch in review but seems not pass CI on  z system. For rocksdb issue hope you <@U0KPFAZNF> can fix it
I dont think the rocksdb thing is real
I just ran a native build on OSX and it got past that
Yup, same here. We really don’t “use” it anywhere in the code.
i still dont have a grasp on whats happening under vagrant/16.04 though
Yes, i also can run it native. So quite odd
I'm happy to be the guinea pig and report on what life is like for those on Windows :slightly_smiling_face:
note that I didn't try building in natively on Windows... such past attempts have left me with no desire to insist going down that route
I'm looking into the vagrant issue as well ... something in sqllite3
right
I just tried a simple  go get <http://github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3|github.com/mattn/go-sqlite3>
and I still get the same error
natively on windows the same error?
no, no, in vagrant
i get some other bizarre error later in the process on OSX
but I am going to leave the native build diagnosis in your hands
i can make forward progress with the docker build, and I need to make some headway there today
that's fine
I opened this for tracking, btw: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1597>
I don’t know why I can’t copy & paste from Slack. Maybe I should use Slack from Vagrant :wink:
ok, thanks
please anybody guide me about the CA requirement in the hyperledger
<@U3NCSU999|hl.rose> has joined the channel
<@U0RD1ALMV|hart.montgomery> has joined the channel

<@U2URL5G8P> It is very generic and may be easier to discuss on the phone.  I can say that it is very generic and pluggable and depends on your needs as to how much of the default impl you can/want to use.

in the US
not sure where you're located

please provide me toll free
or we can connect on skype as well <@U0S5KF44D>

plz provide yours also

What I am working on from order of priority :  1) Incorporating changes from <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3781/>  into <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/3539/>. That will implement <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1372>. 2) Implement FAB 1602 <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1602> 3)Implement FAB 1303 <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1303>. 4)Implement FAB 1598 <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1598>. Please let me know , if you have any questions/comments.
I'll provide progress update here.
